WaterDetection 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • WaterDetection

Reference

All functions

BuildBrickList()

Build a "Brick" object list from a List of FilePaths, and prints time spent;

CalculateCombo()

Adds two raster lists together

CalculateRGBSum()

Calculates the sum of the first 3 bands of a raster, for each raster in a list and prints time spent;

CreateIndividualFolders()

Creates folders for each individual ZOI;

CreateIndividualFolders2()

Creates folders for each individual ZOI, with threshold imbued in the folder name;

CreateIndividualFolders3()

Creates folders for each individual ZOI, with both thresholds imbued in the folder name;

CreateOutputFoldersALL()

Creates some of the folders required to organize outputs in the a certain provided path and prints time spent;

Create_Albufeiras_AllYears_List()

Organizes the argument into a list of lists. The first element is a list of dataframes that represent all the years of a particular ZOI;

CropAndMask()

Cuts and Masks a list of rasters to the zone of a shapefile; Cutting the satellite images to the required zones in the beginning saves a LOT of time; Prints time spent; Might produced an error: "Error in x$.self$finalize() : attempt to apply non-function" but that's an R problem and it doesnt affect the results;

CropShapefile_ExportToPath()

Crops a shapefile into all its individual pieces, by OBJECTID, and exports all the individual shapefiles into ExportPath, and prints time spent; Also produces a global variable called ID_List representing a list of IDs taken from the original shapefile;

ExportRasterList()

Exports a list of rasters and appends the month name to the end, assuming the rasters are ordered by agricultural year; Also prints time spent;

GenerateCSV()

Generates a csv file that contains several rows of information, namely number of Water Cells and Non Water Cells, prints time spent and names the files acordding to the Threshold provided. Accepts a list of lists where each element is a list of all 12 months for a specific year and specific ZOI;

GenerateCSV2()

Generates a csv file that contains several rows of information, namely number of Water Cells and Non Water Cells, prints time spent and names the files acordding to the Threshold provided. Accepts a list of lists where each element is a list of all 12 months for a specific year and specific ZOI;

IndividualAlbufeiraProduct()

Takes a list of products, for example NDVI_2016, and cuts it to each individual ZOI, exporting the results to a certain path;

IndividualAlbufeiraProduct2()

Takes a list of products, for example Binary_NDVI_2016, and cuts it to each individual ZOI, exporting the results to a certain path;

IndividualAlbufeiraProduct3()

Takes a list of products, for example Binary_Combo_2016, and cuts it to each individual ZOI, exporting the results to a certain path;

PlotAllYears_All_Albufeiras()

Plots and exports Water Percentage of the input Dataframes. Produces several plots of a time series of Water Percentage of all the ZOI included in the arguments;

PlotAllYears_All_Albufeiras2()

Plots and exports Water Percentage of the input Dataframes. Produces several plots of a time series of Water Percentage of all the ZOI included in the arguments; This function overlaps the graphs from Dataframe_List_All and Dataframe_List_All_2;

ReadCSVtoDataframe()

Reads a list of CSV files and produce a list of dataframes. CAUTION: You might have to sort the list as it might come unsorted due to file names. Use mixedsort(); CSV_List_Year <<- list.files(path = "XXXX", pattern = "XXXX", full.names = TRUE) Sorted_CSV_List_Year <<- mixedsort(CSV_List_Year)

ReclassRasterList()

Reclassifies a list of rasters acording to the vector provided. The Vectors are generated with the correct formatting by using the function VectorBuilder. Vector1 has NDVI threshold, Vetor 2 has RGMSum threshold and Vetor 3 has the combo to used when reclassifyng the Combo;

TimeRunning()

A gemeral function to collect time spent doing X task. Write StartTime = Sys.time(), then your code, then EndTime = Sys.time(), then

VectorBuilder()

Produces global variables Vector1, 2 and 3

Contents
